name: La Valencia Hotel

reviews.text: I am sorry to say that this, our third trip to La Valencia, was disappointing in several ways. Firstly, the bar and patio restaurant were both closed for renovations. Fine, it has to happen sometime, but there was no attempt to compensate by for example using the large lounge for bar service later. Much of the evening, apart from the main restaurant there was nowhere else to eat or drink. We went out for every meal.
reviews.title: Very disappointing third visit

reviews.text: Much more disappointing was our room. We had reserved Ocean View as before, but this time we were relegated to the Old Cabrillo annexe. I read in the hotel history that this building was a remarkable local construction when erected in 1908. That may be, but in 2013 it is now a rather dilapidated building. There were many small features which need maintenance and care. For example all the window mechanisms were rusted shut and we had to fight to open a window. There is no security to the outside world and anyone could walk into this building.
reviews.title: Compliance Forum LPL Financial
Made for a nice weekend
reviews.text: Our room smelled dusty, musty and disused. Much worse was the fact that water was dripping through the ceiling. It was clearly an air conditioning fault, which we reported to the front desk. It was never fixed. Indeed a considerable quantity of water must have soaked into our floor and the rest of the building below.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even worse was that my valuable guitar was placed under the leak by the bellman. By the time I noticed the water dripping the case was saturated. Fortunately the instrument itself was not damaged. When I reported all this to the management, I expected some recompense, maybe another room, financial reimbursement, repairs done, an apology… None of this happened and despite the Clerk at the front desk promising that the General Manager would be contacting us, he never did. When we checked out I reminded her again. She said he would email me. I waited two weeks before writing this review. No email arrived.
reviews.title: The Perfect Stay

reviews.text: So, in the past I have had good experiences, this time it was one of the worst on our trip and nobody at the hotel seemed to care. Even without the faults the accommodation we were given doesn’t justify the cost.
reviews.title: Perfect spot!

reviews.text: Our recent stay at La Valencia in La Jolla was truly a wonderful experience. The staff was very courteous and helpful, the service was excellent and the food was fantastic (especially the Meyer Lemon Ricotta Pancakes!). I would recommend anyone looking for a beautiful old-style hotel with modern amenities to stay at La V. The view of the ocean from La Sala upon check-in is spectacular and set the tone for our entire stay. The view of the ocean from the 9th floor balcony (Sunset Suite) was amazing, we could not get enough of the ocean view. Lots of shops and restaurants immediately outside the hotel, and it's a very short walk to the coastline where you can see numerous sea lions and seals. The nearby cove (walking distance) offers kayakers a great venue with equipment available for rent. I will definitely stay again at this wonderful hotel, the jewel of La Jolla!
reviews.title: La Valencia

reviews.text: I took my toddler to San Diego for a few days and got this hotel on Priceline for $80/night. We lived in San Diego for many years and are quite familiar with the area, and this was an excellent location to walk to the Cove and local restaurants. However, La Jolla is and always has been kind of weirdly situated, and it would take sometimes over 20 minutes just to get to a freeway! So keep that in mind, it's not exactly a convenient location if you have other places to be.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That said, the hotel was great. We had a nice room and the staff was very accommodating. I read that there were still renovations during our stay, but we didn't hear or see anything. You can walk to some great local restaurants, check out local grass-fed chain Burger Lounge (MUCH better than SmashBurger!) and Cafe Cup for breakfast. If you like salads and other organic foods, there's a little place called Lean and Green, we used to eat there all the time when living there!
reviews.title: Felt as if I was finally Home from a Long Trip

reviews.text: Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel. My toddler loved it and slept really well in their bed and it was nice to be able to take her out to play without strapping her into a car seat. Check out Priceline, you might get lucky too!
reviews.title: Just wonderful!

reviews.text: Checking into La Valencia was a Dream. From the front door, with Valet check in, who caringly said our pile of belongings would be looked after while we checked in. When entering the outside entrance, you first notice the lovely landscaped inside garden with tables and the pictures on the old cafe windows reminding one that this will soon be another part of the beautiful hotel and that History will continue. Once in the reception area, you are bathed in a soft light that immediately soothes you and greeted by two soft spoken receptions who quickly greet you and call you by name and honor you pre requested needs and send you off to your room with that nice bell man Bob.. who shares a lot about the area. We had a lovely room with windows that open, letting in the soft breeze of the afternoon and local sounds. Also, we received a lovely bag, that included a bottle of wine and a sweet. (It was my Birthday) this was thrilling. The room had a wonderful view and from somewhere a wonder smell continue to premeate the room during our stay. We took a long afternoon stroll along the beach and had lunch at Bubba (reasonable and good food). When I returned to the room, there was a wonderful slice of cake and a birthday card from the Staff, I was delightfully surprised.. and the cake was the best. Evening brought us to the Lounge and as the Cerna played we had cocktails and relaxed and watched the fog roll in. Had a light supper there and retired around nine. Feeling as if we had spent the evening at Hearst Castle, very elegant. Morning came and we were told by Bob to that the eggs I was craving could be found at the Brockville Rest on the Beach and so we enjoyed the morning and took off for the next part of our Birthday week... Of all the hotels so far, this was the most enveloping.
reviews.title: Excellent all around

reviews.text: I have stayed here multiple times over the last 6 months as my partner is in San Diego for work.
reviews.title: Pink Lady shines in La Jolla

reviews.text: Highly recommended to all visitors of La Jolla or San Diego. Location of the hotel cannot get any better, you are right by he village where there are lots of boutiques. On the other side you have the ocean! Some ocean facing rooms are so close that you can even hear the seals!
reviews.title: What a treat!

reviews.text: Pool was excellent, gym is on the small side. There was also a piano man during happy hour and the view is second to none for the subset.
reviews.title: Rooms are a bit small, but otherwise a great place to stay in La Jolla.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service was outstanding, have stayed in many 5 star hotels around the globe and hands down this is the best room service I have ever had! Food is seasoned well, hot, fresh and delivered promptly. We ended ordering room service for most nights.
reviews.title: Great but small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hands down one of the best places to stay in La Jolla, friendly staff and the location will blow you away.
reviews.title: The Pink Lady still shines

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from a short getaway to San Diego and we just loved the La Valencia Hotel. We had an upgraded room overlooking the stunning gardens and ocean where I could have sat and relaxed all day. This hotel is stunning. Our room was very clean and comfortable and it was a treat to come back to. Each day we had breakfast in the hotel and the service was warm and welcoming, everyone was more than helpful but not obtrusive. We both had omelettes the first day and they were delicious. The next day I had the french toast and again, really good. We spent one afternoon by the pool and now that we are home I dream of more. Just lovely. Some of the management walking around the property was a little stuffy but this is a more upscale property than we are used to and I understand they are new. The regular staff was relaxed, helpful and very pleasant. I cannot say enough good things about the people that work in this hotel. I would come back in a second....
reviews.title: Pretty in Pink

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Executive Chef (Lance) and his staff are the best in the business. The beverage captain (Michael) is very knowledgeable and friendly. The resort is beautiful and the amenities are fantastic. A must stop for anyone visiting from in or out of town.
reviews.title: Second to none accomodations
Close but no cigar!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Valencia for a get away weekend from SF. Location is outstanding - just off the beach in the middle of La Jolla. The property had lots of charm and was hoping Friday night (music in the lobby). The rooms were nice but a bit small (older property) and we did have a partial ocean view. The halls were abit run down - carpet needs to be redone and the paint touched up. It is midly challenging to navigate the lower floors - 1 small elevator that is slow (lots of demand). We had lunch on the terrace - great ocean views, food hit the mark and we enjoyed a few adult libations. We did a fly buy on the Whale Bar - nice place for a drink before kicking off the evening - bartenders were great! On our next visit to the area, I believe we will head North to the Del Mar area (a bit more layed back).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Valencia was really ideal. We had a beautiful view from our room, the bed was super cozy (major plus,) and everything was as it should be, relaxing and just lovely. Forgetting about the stately charm,perfect location, et cetera,the coolest thing of all is that they welcomed our sweet poochie with open arms! Bravo la Valencia - your fellow top end hotels in the area are not so smart and savvy. But I forgot all about them them the moment I checked in. Wish I could have stayed longer!
reviews.title: Just lovely ... And pet friendly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: **Oh, and the pool is super-fab/dreamy/quintessential lounging too!
reviews.title: By the Sea, By the Beautiful Sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was courteous and extremely polite. We had a corner room with amazing ocean views of the ocean. Multiple weddings were occurring so it was busy but the staff kept up and made us all feel special.
reviews.title: Great stay!
beautiful bathroom has mold smell
reviews.text: I stayed at La Valencia on my wedding night years ago. I went back in april 2013 and got a smaller room no view for a great price. I was so excited. I did not mind the very small bathroom due to the price. the bathroom looked recently renovated but I noticed a strange odor. the next morning I realized that I had been exposed to mold . I suspect that they did not remove the mold when they refurbished. I am asthmatic and spent the next 2 days recovering from the exposure.

reviews.title: Almost perfect, but...
reviews.text: This hotel is a beautiful piece of architecture, in a fabulous part of la Jolla, with the beach and park on one side, and great restaurants and shopping on the other. The property is awesome, on a hillside, but be prepared to use a lot of steps, unless you have a room close to an elevator. We stayed in a beautiful villa in the far west area of the property, just above street level. The pool is gorgeous, the grounds are taken care of, the flowers are beautiful all over the property. We arrived for a romantic weekend, and had taken advantage of a Travelzoo offer. I was contacted a few weeks before my arrival to see if I wanted to upgrade to a partial ocean view for an additional charge, which I accepted. We checked in, was given our room key, and when we entered our room, not only was there no ocean view, there were 2 queen beds, not the king we reserved. The only remedy to this was to spend an additional $500 for the villa, which we did decide to switch to. It had a great private patio, and a beautiful bedroom and bath. No fault of the hotel, there was a lot of traffic all day and into the evening, which could be loud at times. If all of the villas are located at the west of the hotel, then expect the traffic noise. We never had the opportunity to eat in the hotel. Parking was expensive at $29 a day, especially when we saw our car parked in the Citibank parking lot a block away...not very secure, although La Jolla is a pretty safe place itself. Overall, we did have a great time, our dog loved it, and the weather was amazing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Valencia is one of the premier hotels near the Cove in La Jolla. The property is old, and parts of it are somewhat dated. We splurged on an oceanfront room, but the view wasn't nearly as nice as the last time we stayed (2010). Two large wedding parties were also at the hotel, so that may have been the reason our room wasn't as nice. Parts of the hotel are undergoing renovation. Hopefully all floors will be included eventually, since our room was bordering on shabby. The bathroom was very small. The hotel has only one elevator, so be prepared to walk the stairs or wait during busy times. Staff is very friendly and accommodating.
reviews.title: Pink Princess in La Jolla

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Near the end of our December California Coast road trip, we were more than ready to kick back and cool our heels. Never having been to La Jolla before, and not planning ahead, we'd first passed through La Jolla after a short stop and then tried to find a sweet spot in San Diego.
reviews.title: A Charming Pink Jewel in La Jolla!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I returned to La Jolla, the location of our wedding and other significant events, for our tenth wedding anniversary. We chose to stay at La Valencia, the multi-storied and much-storied hotel on Prospect Street, on a rise above Scripps Park and the ocean. Good choice. The weather didn't cooperate (gray, gray, gray ... until the day we left) and the hotel was undergoing renovations here and there. But this was more than made up for by the superb staff and kind attention to detail. (Special thanks to Michelle and Brian at the front desk and Bob and other members of the welcoming valet team.) For instance, a wedding reception bumped us from the restaurant (the site of our anniversary dinner), but the management set us up in front of the magnificent picture window overlooking the Pacific, at the end of a dramatic Spanish Colonial Revival lobby that would put a spring in the step of Norma Desmond. The dinner was fantastic, and the champagne complimentary (an apology for making the new wedding more important than our old one -- there were also wine, chocolate strawberries, and a rose in our room). The room itself had been upgraded to ocean view. Plus we got a late check out (due to ear-splitting tile cutting and repair going on for hours around the pool, dissuading us from using the area until the day we checked out and the noise abated). We would definitely return and suggest you check out this nationally registered historic pink pile on the hill. As repairs and upgrades are finished (refurbished elevator, etc.) La Valencia will emerge as a lady of a certain age who's just been "freshened up" a bit to stay in the game -- a familiar enough sight in southern California. Here's an additional tip: overnight hotel parking is pricey at almost $30... but it's possible to park overnight on some nearby streets if you pay attention to signs, including on the curving street behind the hotel that runs down to the park and beach, believe it or not).
reviews.title: The Pink Lady Has a Glow About Her

reviews.text: Did not stay at the hotel but enjoyed a wonderful lunch in the Mediterranean Room looking out over the Pacific. The setting is perfect, the food excellent, and the service was very attentive without being bothersome. We enjoyed lunch with friends and at no time felt rushed even though the restaurant was quite busy. It appears to be a favourite even of the locals. It's definitely a place we'll visit whenever we're in the area.
reviews.title: The Mediterranean Room at la Valencia

reviews.text: We just spent a long weekend at the La Valencia Hotel and were very pleased with the entire experience. From the beautiful views,amazing staff, and easy accessable location coupled with fine dining and great rooms, we found a it to be a little slice of heaven.
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I with another couple spent two wonderful days and nights at this historic, beautifully maintained hotel. The hotel dates from the early 1920's and has many interesting old photos of the hotel during different eras. Also photos of old movies stars and various famous people who have made the La Valencia their spot in La Jolla.
reviews.title: A Gem in La Jolla, California

reviews.text: We had a spectacular view from our room of the ocean and coastline. We could see the seals and surfers riding the waves and hear the seals occasionally barking to each other, funny sounds!
reviews.title: Beautiful Setting

reviews.text: This is an absolutely beautiful place to stay. We had a partial ocean view that's was fantastic. We woke up every morning to the sights of the ocean and a cool breeze as we slept with the windows open every night. Highly recommend!
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived the hotel staff was very attentive and took care of everything from scheduling massages to restaurant reservations.
reviews.title: Awesome!
Classic Beach Hotel
reviews.text: We would highly recommend staying at the La Valencia Hotel while in La Jolla.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed there with my family, and loved it. Beautiful. Historic. Classic.
reviews.title: "Perfect Vacation Hotel"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at La Valencia was so much more than we ever expected! We were treated royally, had exceptional service, and the hotel was beautiful. We were upgraded to a lovely room with every amenity, hugh flat screen tv, and a very modern bathroom. The views of the Pacific were spectacular, and the gardens on the grounds were covered with lavish flowers, bushes, and trees.
reviews.title: A very nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Valencia occupies the perfect spot in La Jolla. Its location at the heart of the action and right across a small park from the ocean make it incomparable. Almost everything about the property lives up to that location. It’s a rambling building with multiple floors and wings, staggered down the hillside with a string of bungalows at the foot.
reviews.title: Very attractive hotel and views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is set in a beautiful location mid hillside, surrounded by luxuriant foliage and partly shaded; the water is warm and inviting.
reviews.title: VERY nice.......but Very Expensive..........

reviews.text: All of the service worked very well for us. The room service, the waiters, the barman were all good and attentive. There is a terrace which overlooks the pool and gardens which is ideal for drinks or tapas. These are served with style.
reviews.title: We love La V!

reviews.text: We were upgraded to a sea-view bungalow, which was an unexpected bonus. This was a wonderful room and the bathroom was huge, with tub, shower and built-in steam facilities.
reviews.title: awesome experience stunning hotel

reviews.text: A few things weren’t perfect. The restaurant was a great location, but the menu was rather unexciting and pricey. The lounge area ended bar-service very early, leaving only the Whalers bar for a drink, which is fine if you like a fairly loud environment. If you don’t then you are out of options. The lounge should be open until at least 11pm for bar service.
reviews.title: Tired hotel

description: The La Valencia Hotel is more than a La Jolla hotel, it’s an icon, having hosted celebrities, celebrations, reunions and romantic getaways since 1926. Just steps from miles of stunning coastline, world-class museums, shopping and galleries, it’s the perfect blend of location and recreation. The hotel’s Mediterranean influenced architecture and décor, including beautiful courtyards, hand painted murals and exquisite Spanish mosaics, evoke old-world charm in this one of a kind La Jolla hotel. Choose from 112 coastal-inspired luxury guest rooms, suites and Ocean Villas featuring stunning views of La Jolla and the Pacific Ocean, lush tropical landscaping, or picturesque La Jolla village. And, with three distinctive restaurants, including the award winning Sky Room and Whaling Bar & Grill, as well as indoor and outdoor conference, catering and wedding facilities, La Valencia is the ideal location to vacation, meet and celebrate. Experience the beauty of Southern California in one of San Diego’s most elegant and historic hotels, and become a part of La Valencia’s history.
